name: Hilton Garden Inn Outer Banks/Kitty Hawk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this place. My wife and I stay here multiple times each year because we love the hotel, the staff, and the location. The hotel is situated perfectly in Kitty Hawk as soon as you reach the island. The property is great, with access to the Kitty Hawk Pier for fishing or just taking in the view. The rooms are quite large and spacious and all rooms have a view, even if they're not oceanfront. I particularly love the breakfast, and I've found the kitchen staff to be extremely accommodating. The french toast, omelets, and pancakes are fantastic and the cook that makes them is super friendly and always helpful. I have yet to use the indoor pool and exercise room but both are great amenities and look like excellent facilities. We find that this is a great place to stay when we want to go to the beach to get away from everything at home. We always leave here feeling relaxed and always have a great time while we're here. If you enjoy hanging out on the beach, you can rent umbrellas, chairs, and even floats and boogies boards directly from the hotel right on the beach. The pool, which is oceanfront on the hotel side of the dunes, always has the best sea breeze. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone that likes to visit the Outer Banks and that wants the comforts of home while being at the beach.
reviews.title: Always A Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start by saying my spouse and I travel and stay in hotels approximately 8 weeks per year, so we are more accustomed and expect a certain level of service from a hotel that is a member of the hilton chain. We are probably more sophisiticated in our travels and have alot to compare it too.
reviews.title: Poor service and pricey for what you get

reviews.text: When we are spending $300 per night for a ocean front room, there are bare minimums that need to be met, that quite frankly were never addressed,even after numerous attempts to do so.
reviews.title: Great location and stay

reviews.text: Had several issues with the following:during a 6 night stay housekeeping just couldnt get it right...one day fresh towels and coffee, completely unmaid bed. another day didnt attempt to really make the bed right and put the pillows on it, left it the way I covered it, what gives seriously I am paying $300 a night for this?next day bed made half a with bed pillows but 1 bath towel, 2 hand towels, no bath rug, 1 wash cloth???I can only assume they do not have enough staff and work them half to death so they cant do the proper cleaning of the rooms, and yes we did tip so I really dont know what was up.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok so you get the picture if I were paying $50 a night I might not be upset but this is ridiculous...the bed SUCKS doesnt even come close to a marriott bed and well the service lets put it this way my previous three vacations this year in hawaii at the marriott we paid about the same money as this hotel and it was FAR SUPERIOR...other HUGE TURN OFF we had people above us that would open and close their sliding doors non stop every 30 seconds for HOURS I phoned the front desk at 11:20 pm one night they didnt make them stop and they continued until 1:15 a.m. before they quieted down and obviously went to sleep, then it started about 7 a.m. in the morning. Front desk did not resolve this issue. It happened every night. Again we spoke to the front desk at about 10:30p.m. another night and insisted they make them stop...I told them if it didnt I would be seeking a credit for my stay that it was ridiculous and I was getting tired of it. It did stop at least until they woke us up in the morning doing it again.
reviews.title: Excellent full service hotel in the midst of beach rentals

reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights, two of them next door to our son, daughter and granddaughter; then two more to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Absolutely the best Hilton Garden Inn we've found, equal to much more expensive beach resorts.
reviews.title: Superb Beachfront Resort Hotel!

reviews.text: The food was outstanding--much better than the usual Garden Inn fare! Service was top-notch from the desk staff, to the waitresses, to the maids. Everyone was cheerful and wanting to give the best service possible. They really helped us relax into the resort mindset right away.
reviews.title: Very good overall experience. Friendly staff, phenomenal location!

reviews.text: Oceanfront room was clean, and contained all the amenities including fridge and microwave. Outdoor pool vacuumed nightly to keep sand out (from beach).
reviews.title: Great weekend stay!

reviews.text: We were very pleased with everything here, and will return for another stay soon!
reviews.title: Nice stay on beautiful beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please understand that these are beachfront hotel rooms. Not houses, or condos. They are comfortable, but without frills. You would expect to pay $90 a night or less elsewhere. Here, you pay for a newer facility, and the beach. There is a pier here as well, which is nice for leisure. If traveling with kids you might want to consider a house or condo for the extra space and ammenities, or two rooms. It is modest and cramped.
reviews.title: Never in my life have I been treated with so little respect.

reviews.text: Stayed on a Tues night... great check-in, very clean room, quiet, faced the ocean/beach/pier-- nice pool area. Good breakfast in the morning and they were great when we asked to extend our check-out time to 12:30 instead of 11am. Look forward to my next stay. Suspect it may be loud and more crazy during the height of the season. but would definitely go back in "off season times". Also, great location between Duck/Corolla and Nags Head!
reviews.title: overnight stay for R&R

reviews.text: This was my first trip to this property, and for the most part, most Hilton Garden Inns are pretty much the same. The property itself is beautiful. However, the rooms are a different story. After checking in (this was a free stay using Hilton rewards), we go to our room. We walk in, there's a newpaper on the floor, someone's McDonalds cup sitting on the nightstand, the pillow looked liked someone slept on it, the ice bucket is full of water and there's a used bar of soap sitting out in the bathroom. It looked like the housekeeper decided she didn't want to finish cleaning the room ! It was pretty disgusting, so we marched right down to the front desk. They were very apologetic and immediately gave us a new room. Well, taking a shower later that night (room 210), within 2 minutes, the water in the tub had backed up and was ankle deep ! They obviously need to Drano that tub ! Finally, being a Diamond member, I am always comped breakfast vouchers for my wife, my daughter and myself. Well, I only received two breakfast coupons, which was disappointing, especially after the ordeal at checki-in. I guess since you have a free room, you get what you paid for. As I said, the property itself is beautiful and ideally located. After this experience though, I'm wasn't impressed enough to want to stay here again.
reviews.title: Not the Best of Stays !

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed here though we usually stay in corolla.
reviews.title: Really, that is really the $18 plate of food!

reviews.text: Everything started off great and generally was.
reviews.title: Good location, nice facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like renting movies (who doesn't in a hotel) you will be dissapointed with there sub par TV's that are blurry.
reviews.title: Affordable Honeymoon

reviews.text: When you combine an incomparable oceanfront property, outstanding professional service, exceptionally accommodating friendly staff in a hotel with the trusted Hilton name you have the key ingredients for an exceptional, oceanfront vacation experience. First of all the Outer Banks is a unique ocean/ beach location. I know thing or two about beach locations because I live in and travel around Florida. Unlike Florida where beaches are usually lined with mammoth condos structures, and the Outer Banks you'll find beach houses lining the beaches, people riding their bikes to and from, and the comfortable down home beach experience that is second to none. It is truly a special place. The Hilton Garden combines beauty, functionality and comfort in its design. Everything you could possibly want to do during your beach vacation you can do either at the hotel or buried close nearby. You can swim in the ocean, the pool, work out at the hotel exercise room or take advantage of their partnership with a larger gym facility. The hotel has its own fishing pier and there were several additional piers nearby. Every kind of water sport is available close by including jet skiing, boating, parasailing, windsurfing, surfing,etc. Note that the water temperature is cool. At least it is from my perspective but then of course I live in Florida. This is one of the few places in the United States where you go hang gliding for both the novice and the more experienced. So if you are like me and you enjoy trying new experiences, there's plenty to do in the Outer Banks. The staff in the hotel personifies the friendly, caring, southern hospitality that is typical of the unpretentious South. This is a lovely place to stay, next year I will return again but stay much longer. One of the surprising memories for me is that although I am not typically a meat eater, don't usually eat more than two steaks or hamburgers a year, I had maybe the best hamburger I have ever tasted anywhere (and I've done alot of traveling) at this Hilton Garden. I took a bite of the hamburger my son ordered and ordered one for myself without thinking twice. Although I felt a little guilty, I had to have another one and it was the last thing I did before I left the hotel. Don't leave the Outer Banks without ordering a hamburger and french fries at this hotel. About the sleep quality, I must have known feather non down pillows feather beds etc. I think one of the pillows that I slept on the first night was feather because I was a little stuffy in the morning. I left a note for the housekeeper asking that anything that was farther be replaced with hypoallergenic, there were different pillows when I returned that afternoon. Everything combined makes this vacation experience at this hotel just about perfect. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel, incomparable location, outstanding friendly service–a GEM

reviews.text: First, ;et me say there are not an abundance of places to stay (hotels) on the Outer Banks that are named chains. I would stay at the Hampton Inn in Duck/Corolla next time. This hotel is right at the main light in Kitty Hawk. If you go North, you will find the more affluent houses and shops on the Outer Banks. VERY nice area. If you go south, you will be in a VERY commercial area (much like Panama City Florida) that has souvenier shops every few feet for about 20 miles until you get to the road taking you to Cape Hatteras (which was also a very nice area).
reviews.title: Just OK! Some pro's and some con's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PRO-
reviews.title: Location Says It All!

reviews.text: * RIght on ocean over looking the pier
reviews.title: So happy I stayed here!

reviews.text: * Restauraunt in the lobby to eat at
reviews.title: excellent July 4th Weekend

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Outer Banks/Kitty Hawk Hotel
